intro: Erigeron traversii, commonly known as the plains fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, grasslands, and disturbed areas, often reaching heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron traversii is known for its ability to thrive in dry conditions and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value.
